line.comment: * SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Plot.DropClue
* DESCRIPTION: Called when a renegade OR Pirate is killed BY the player in !ship.signal.killed, this has a chance of dropping a clue
* for the hidden sector gate, or some random lore of interest.
* AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
* DATE: 1 April 2024
* No clues if the player already know where the renegades are.
* If we were unable to acquire an unknown Enclave system at game startup, just return. Don't spawn anything.
* Initialization
* the prefix is one of several messages that look like: "Upon inspection of the ship wreckage you find a communications pod with a partial message still in the buffer:"
* If the player killed a pirate, there is a small chance they get here and we drop some useful information about the renegades.
* Only a dead renegade can drop a clue about entry into the renegade station system, but pirates can drop useful info.
* Add-Ons 1.1: Fixed random chance (was 2/11 chance; now 3/20 as intended to drop info) and added random races for more flavor.
* 15% chance we drop a clue from a pirate: 10% useful intel, 5% lore. Note this occurs only if the player directly does the killing. See !ship.signal.killed.
* 0 = assessment of the renegade station ship strength.
* What's up %s? Yea, I was just back at that renegade base for repairs and a bath. The docking bay seemed pretty busy. I saw at least %s class %s ships sitting there, so they seem ready for anything.
* 1 = a random renegade location
* Hey %s hows things? I was hunting over in %s and noticed a strange ship hanging out. Thought he may be one of those renegades so I gave him a wide berth. Watch your six buddy.
* 2 = random lore
* Add-Ons 1.1: Lore includes:
* 1. No one likes the renegades. We offer them bribes to keep them off our backs.
* 2. You did not get this from me, but rumor has it that a %s named %s hired the renegades to attack the Independents. No one knows why they were hired.
* 3. I heard rumors that a fellow pirate named %s is secretly funding the renegades. Do not snitch him out or our heads are next.
* If this is our first renegade that died, we start the mission and return.
* What is this broken hull that lies before you? ...
* ... you to believe something important has been staged in %s...
* Upon death of the first renegade you start the Renegade Mission
* 1. Start Mission (add-ons 1.2: formalized renegade storyline)

line.text: 'Уничтожайте корабли Ренегатов, чтобы получить фрагменты кода врат. Соберите 3 уникальных фрагмента кода, а затем просканируйте '

line.comment: * show one of the static clues.
* Pop clue off stack, combine it with the prefix and show it.
* 2. Update mission when player drops a clue.
* Safety below but should never happen - this script returns null if the gate is already revealed.
* The station otherwise exists until after the gate is revealed.
* Add-Ons 1.4.10: Fixed a bug...as it reports NA even though there's ships! As such, better to get the number of owned ships instead (does not count M7Cs that have support fighters).
* Add-Ons 1.4.21: We now get the exact number of ships. On easy, this is always M3. On normal, it's M3 or M6. On hard or insane, it's M6 or M7.
* No ships created and homebased the Renegade station.
* Must have ships homebased to the station for this clue to specify ship count and class.
* Easy: M3s only.
* Normal: 33% chance to tell how many M6s, 66% chance to tell how many M3.
* There's M6s!
* Otherwise (or if no M6s exist), report how many M3 there are instead.
* Hard and insane: 33% chance to tell how many M7s, 66% chance to tell how many M6.
* There's M7s!
* Otherwise (or if no M7s exist), report how many M6 there are instead.

sval.val: Renegades clue Prefixes not found.
Уничтожайте корабли Ренегатов, чтобы получить фрагменты кода врат. Соберите 3 уникальных фрагмента кода, а затем просканируйте
в секторе
Ренегаты
Центр Ренегатов
Ренегаты
НД
SCRIPT NAME: Renegades.Plot.DropClue
DESCRIPTION: Called when a renegade OR Pirate is killed BY the player in !ship.signal.killed, this has a chance of dropping a clue
for the hidden sector gate, or some random lore of interest.
AUTHOR: Mr Mordan
DATE: 1 April 2024
No clues if the player already know where the renegades are.
If we were unable to acquire an unknown Enclave system at game startup, just return. Don't spawn anything.
the prefix is one of several messages that look like: "Upon inspection of the ship wreckage you find a communications pod with a partial message still in the buffer:"
If the player killed a pirate, there is a small chance they get here and we drop some useful information about the renegades.
Only a dead renegade can drop a clue about entry into the renegade station system, but pirates can drop useful info.
Add-Ons 1.1: Fixed random chance (was 2/11 chance; now 3/20 as intended to drop info) and added random races for more flavor.
15% chance we drop a clue from a pirate: 10% useful intel, 5% lore. Note this occurs only if the player directly does the killing. See !ship.signal.killed.
0 = assessment of the renegade station ship strength.
What's up %s? Yea, I was just back at that renegade base for repairs and a bath. The docking bay seemed pretty busy. I saw at least %s class %s ships sitting there, so they seem ready for anything.
1 = a random renegade location
Hey %s hows things? I was hunting over in %s and noticed a strange ship hanging out. Thought he may be one of those renegades so I gave him a wide berth. Watch your six buddy.
2 = random lore
Add-Ons 1.1: Lore includes:
1. No one likes the renegades. We offer them bribes to keep them off our backs.
2. You did not get this from me, but rumor has it that a %s named %s hired the renegades to attack the Independents. No one knows why they were hired.
3. I heard rumors that a fellow pirate named %s is secretly funding the renegades. Do not snitch him out or our heads are next.
If this is our first renegade that died, we start the mission and return.
What is this broken hull that lies before you? ...
... you to believe something important has been staged in %s...
Upon death of the first renegade you start the Renegade Mission
1. Start Mission (add-ons 1.2: formalized renegade storyline)
show one of the static clues.
Pop clue off stack, combine it with the prefix and show it.
2. Update mission when player drops a clue.
Safety below but should never happen - this script returns null if the gate is already revealed.
The station otherwise exists until after the gate is revealed.
Add-Ons 1.4.10: Fixed a bug...as it reports NA even though there's ships! As such, better to get the number of owned ships instead (does not count M7Cs that have support fighters).
Add-Ons 1.4.21: We now get the exact number of ships. On easy, this is always M3. On normal, it's M3 or M6. On hard or insane, it's M6 or M7.
No ships created and homebased the Renegade station.
Must have ships homebased to the station for this clue to specify ship count and class.
Easy: M3s only.
Normal: 33% chance to tell how many M6s, 66% chance to tell how many M3.
There's M6s!
Otherwise (or if no M6s exist), report how many M3 there are instead.
Hard and insane: 33% chance to tell how many M7s, 66% chance to tell how many M6.
There's M7s!
Otherwise (or if no M7s exist), report how many M6 there are instead.
